main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted over Elberton, Alabama on October 22, 1952, by Lt. Theodore L. Pascoc and two enlisted men.
interesting points: The object was round in shape, metallic in appearance, and approximately 30 feet in diameter., It was observed moving in a northerly direction at an estimated speed of 500 knots or more., The object was stationary for a brief moment before disappearing from sight at high speed., No sound was heard during the sighting., The weather conditions were clear with unlimited visibility.
sighted object: a round, metallic object approximately 30 feet in diameter
witness description: Lt. Theodore L. Pascoc and two enlisted men
